KSP's atmospheric physics stop at 10^-6 times surface pressure. But you can set maxAtmosphereAltitude to any value. If it's above that altitude, there will be no atmosphere between the altitude where the pressure is 10^-6 times surface pressure and maxAtmosphereAltitude. So the behavior you've noticed might be a result of Nova setting Jool's maxAtmosphereAltitude too high and surface pressure too high as well. Or it might be some other bug.

KSP's atmospheric physics stop at 10^-6 times surface pressure. But you can set maxAtmosphereAltitude to any value. If it's above that altitude, there will be no atmosphere between the altitude where the pressure is 10^-6 times surface pressure and maxAtmosphereAltitude. So the behavior you've noticed might be a result of Nova setting Jool's maxAtmosphereAltitude too high and surface pressure too high as well. Or it might be some other bug.
